bill.title: An act relating to preserving the right to abortion
bill.description: An act relating to preserving the right to abortion

history.action: Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on Human Services
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. McCoy of Poultney
Rep. Pugh of South Burlington moved that the bill be committed to the committee on Judiciary which was agreed to.
Read Second Time
Rep. Pugh of South Burlington reported for the committee on Human Services
Rep. Grad of Moretown reported for the committee on Judiciary
Report of the Committee on Human Services amended as recommended by the Committee on Judiciary
Rep. Rosenquist of Georgia moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 41, Nays = 106
Amendment as offered by Rep. Rosenquist of Georgia disagreed to
Rep. Rosenquist of Georgia and Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 40, Nays = 107
Amendment as offered by Rep. Rosenquist of Georgia and Bancroft of Westford disagreed to
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Amendment as offered by Rep. Bancroft of Westford withdrawn
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 32, Nays = 115
Amendment as offered by Rep. Bancroft of Westford disagreed to
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 24, Nays = 123
Amendment as offered by Rep. Bancroft of Westford disagreed to
Rep. Strong of Albany moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 146 to Pass -- Yeas = 33, Nays = 113
Amendment as offered by Rep. Strong of Albany disagreed to
Rep. Strong of Albany moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 73 of 144 to Pass -- Yeas = 13, Nays = 131
Amendment as offered by Rep. Strong of Albany disagreed to
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the report of the committee on Human Services
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 73 of 144 to Pass -- Yeas = 43, Nays = 101
Amendment as offered by Rep. Bancroft of Westford disagreed to
Report of Committee on Human Services as amended agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 73 of 144 to Pass -- Yeas = 104, Nays = 40
Third Reading Ordered
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the bill
Rep. Bartholomew of Hartland raised a Point of Order
Amendment of Rep. Bancroft of Westford ruled not germane
Rep. Donahue of Northfield moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 146 to Pass -- Yeas = 37, Nays = 109
Amendment as offered by Rep. Donahue of Northfield disagreed to
Rep. Donahue of Northfield moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 146 to Pass -- Yeas = 40, Nays = 106
Amendment as offered by Rep. Donahue of Northfield disagreed to
Rep. Donahue of Northfield moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 73 of 145 to Pass -- Yeas = 37, Nays = 108
Amendment as offered by Rep. Donahue of Northfield disagreed to
Rep. McFaun of Barre Town moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 72 of 143 to Pass -- Yeas = 37, Nays = 106
Amendment as offered by Rep. McFaun of Barre Town disagreed to
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 71 of 141 to Pass -- Yeas = 28, Nays = 113
Amendment as offered by Rep. Bancroft of Westford disagreed to
Read Third time
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 72 of 143 to Pass -- Yeas = 106, Nays = 37
Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Health and Welfare
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report by Committee on Health and Welfare
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Lyons for Committee on Health and Welfare
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare agreed to
Roll Call, requested by Senator McNeil, Passed -- Needed 16 of 30 to Pass -- Yeas = 28, Nays = 2
3rd reading ordered on roll call, requested by Senator Benning, Passed -- Needed 16 of 30 to Pass -- Yeas = 24, Nays = 6
New Business/Third Reading
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Ashe
Senate Message, passed in Concurrence with proposal of amendment
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in
House message: House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment
Delivered to the Governor on June 5, 2019
Signed by Governor on June 10, 2019
House message: Governor approved bill on June 10, 2019
